resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
vibhatha opened a new pull request, #14132:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14132

   This PR is work in progress.

vibhatha commented on code in PR #14132:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14132#discussion_r972506135


##########
cpp/src/arrow/filesystem/path_util.h:
##########
@@ -75,6 +75,9 @@ util::string_view RemoveTrailingSlash(util::string_view s);
 ARROW_EXPORT
 Status AssertNoTrailingSlash(util::string_view s);
 
+ARROW_EXPORT
+Status AssertLeadingSlash(util::string_view s);

Review Comment:
   Should this be just return bool? It is a bit doubtful and tried to maintain the convention already in use.
   
   cc @westonpace

vibhatha commented on PR #14132:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14132#issuecomment-1249965879

   cc @ArianaVillegas @sanjibansg

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: At the moment the `GlobFiles` function hasn't been tested with an end-to-end Substrait-To-Arrow case. Also observed that leading slash is ignored in this API. Proposed changes are adding test cases to cover the fix including end-to-end test cases.
fields.summary: [C++] Add File Handling Test cases for GlobFile handling in Substrait Read
